case_title: MUHAMMAD BASHIR vs PUNJAB PROVINCE AND 7 OTHERS

accussed_details.name: Deputy Commissioner, Muzaffargarh
allegation: Illegal appointment of junior clerks ignoring the petitioner

complaint_summary: Muhammad Bashir challenged the appointment of junior clerks made by the Deputy Commissioner, Muzaffargarh, on 13th January 1970, claiming his legal right to the post based on his inclusion in the approved candidates list maintained since 1962.
investigation_summary: The petitioner argued that the list of approved candidates was valid under rule 3.5 of the District Office Manual, which was saved under rule 11 of the West Pakistan Revenue Department District Ministerial Service Rules, 1964. Respondent No. 1 contended that the petitioner had no legal right as the list was discontinued after 1964.
judgment_summary: The court ruled in favor of Muhammad Bashir, declaring that he was entitled to be appointed as a junior clerk on 13th January 1970. The Deputy Commissioner's actions and subsequent orders by the Commissioner and Board of Revenue were deemed illegal and ineffective.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition accepted; declaratory decree passed in favor of Muhammad Bashir.
legal_arguments: Rule 3.5 of the District Office Manual saved under rule 11 of the West Pakistan Revenue Department District Ministerial Service Rules, 1964.
Publication of notice for test and interview did not override the petitioner's legal right based on the approved candidates list.
statutes: West Pakistan Revenue Department District Ministerial Service Rules, 1964

witness_statement.Rehmat Ilahi: Confirmed that the list of approved candidates was maintained till October 1969.

key_issues: Validity of the approved candidates list under rule 3.5
Legal right of the petitioner to appointment as junior clerk
Effect of non-appearance in test and interview

legal_terms.Declaratory Decree: A court judgment that determines the rights of parties without ordering any specific action or awarding damages.

words_and_phrases.Initial Recruitment: The process of filling vacancies through direct appointment.

summary_vector_notes: Muhammad Bashir filed a revision petition challenging the appointment of junior clerks by the Deputy Commissioner, Muzaffargarh, claiming his legal right based on the approved candidates list maintained under rule 3.5 of the District Office Manual. The court ruled in favor of the petitioner, declaring the appointments and subsequent orders by higher authorities illegal and ineffective.
